intro: Cosmibuena longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered cosmibuena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces elongated, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
